page.title: 12THE SCHOOL NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Two and a half acres of steeply sloped woodland at the back of Kewstoke school has in the last three years been developed into an area of study. Aided by the Avon Wildlife Trust and other bodies the children of the school have helped to create from rough, overgrown woodland a managed site that has a pond, an open air classroom and steps made of sycamores cut down in the initial thinning stages. The awards from the Shell Better Britain scheme have been won together with first prize in a competition run by the Weston-super-Mare Civic Society. A birdhide is to be built this Autumn (1985) from funds raised at the School fete in June.
